Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nasir I
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this fine hotel for 14 days. Location is good close to Internet and Media city. Emirates mall is also very close. Hotel staff are polite and caring. Rooms are large and comfortable. I am frequent traveler to Dubai and stayed in many hotels. I think I will remember this hotel for long time. I really like the thank all the staff who served me by my heart particularly in the resturant where I was taking my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel - Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Asim B
Reviews.Content: It was my first holiday in Dubai with my other half. Have to say it was exactly what I expected and more. My wife was so pleased with our choice of hotel that she has said the next time we decide to visit Dubai, we would defo stay at the Media Rotana. The rooms and the hotel overall was unbelievably clean, the room service was amazing and the customer service within the hotel is second to none. Everywhere you go, be it to the breakfast room, outside the hotel or just walking past the main reception, we were always greeted with a smile and a hello. Made us feel really welcome. All the staff at the Media Rotana were very friendly and helpful. But there was one person at Media Rotana who made our stay at the hotel extra special. He was a young man called ‘Kenneth’; I just can’t praise him as a person and his customer service enough; Very polite, very helpful and a true gentleman!. As it was our first holiday in Dubai and I did not know what and how to arrange our excursions/trips, Kenneth kindly provided us with his recommendations of what is worth doing and seeing as well as booking all our trips and making sure we were looked after at all times. This made our trips extra enjoyable and headache free. Both me and my wife were so grateful to him that we feel he is a real asset to the Media Rotana. On the location of he hotel, it is in a quite location which was nice, just what we were looking for, The metro was close by which was also a plus (10 min walk) and if you ask anyone, the taxi’s are very cheap so getting to places in Dubai was not a problem. Overall a very nice place to stay ‘Media Rotana’…..’Recommended!’.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CHOICE !!!”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: I was told by one of the hotel staff that I couldn't have a visitor to visit me ! She was a friend of mine ! They said because I'm a guy visitors are not allowed in the room !! what a pathetic hotel ! I've never seen hotels that won't allow visitors to visit ! This is more like a hospital not a hotel !! Don't go there ! There are plenty of hotels in dubai that are WAY better !

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised..”
Reviews.Author: Tanis T
Reviews.Content: I have seen this hotel pop up in a number of searches for hotels in Dubai but was always a bit leery to try it. Whenever Dubai hotels are full, this seems to be the only Rotana hotel that isn't sold out. I finally took a chance on it and was very happy! The hotel is very clean and efficient. The room was huge and comfortable. The roof terrance and the pub on the main floor were both great! It isn't in the best location if you don't have a car - but very easy to locate and travel from if you do. The only negative was that I felt like they were constantly rushing us to leave - both on the terrace and in my room. The morning of checkout, there was a knock at the door at 9:00 am and then a glowing message on the TV at 10:30 am asking when we were leaving. Odd since checkout was at noon. I would definitely pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: sageyLondon
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, excellent service and immaculately clean. The staff were very welcoming and the housekeeping team were lovely and very accomodating. The pool is clean and although not wide it is very long and lovely and warm. Breakfast is excellent with so many choices and the staff and chef are very polite and helpful. Taxi's wait outside but use the tube which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, spotlessly clean and on time, very impressive! Nelson's bar looked fun and had events on every night although we didn't get chance to use it. A lovely, impressive hotel with great customer service. Thank you so much for a wonderful week and my grateful thanks to the housekeeping team for all their hard work. Thank you Rotana i would love to come and stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rotana”
Reviews.Author: Tim A
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff very friendly and go out of their way to please. Rooms really clean and maintained well too. Pool area does not have sun all day due to positioning of hotel towers at either side. But again pool is nice and clean and the terrace bar is very good. Hotel restaurants are good too. Only downside for our family is that the hotel seems to have terrace bar parties most evenings with loud dance music till the early hours. If you get a pool room view (like we did) then you will hear the base of the music till the early hours (2.30am every night). And when it finishes the party goers leaving in their supercars (Lamborghinis and Ferraris) tend to be noisy too. Location is a bit out of town for the main attractions and is not on the big bus tour route but taxis are easy to get 24hrs and are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel, close to Mall of Emirates,”
Reviews.Author: BennyPL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 4 nights. Rooms are pretty spacious, very comfortable. There were no problem with changing room for another with bayview. Service is ok, food pretty much ok (big variety of seafood). I used this hotel for as a base for sightseeing. If you are looking for the hotel for a family vacation this is not a good choice. For business and sightseeing purposes it's excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Dubai, very near to Mall fo the Emirates”
Reviews.Author: AsifD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Media Rotana many times, hotel is good, nice service, you cannot say top class but still Good! need to maintain as I have noticed some slackiness, there was a lot of construction around before and no place go close by earlier, now things are ready and one can walk around, it's close to Mall of the Emirates, 5 minutes by Taxi

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy this hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: It's not in a great area if you want to experience Dubai. It is good for work if you are based at Media/Internet city. But the Hotel itself does have enough of a vibe to keep you interested. It has an irish bar which is always busy. And also a new club on the 1st floor floor, which a lto of expats visit. All in all, a decent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fifty Fifty...”
Reviews.Author: Fareed85
Reviews.Content: For the same rating and price I think u can get a better hotel.. Pluses are Close to Metro - around 7 to 10 minutes walk Very Nice courteous staff - all the way Very Nice breakfast Room was not bad.. Bad points are Washroom was stinking when I checked in Slow check in TV turned on automatically in the middle of the tight.. it happened thrice during my 30 day stay.. - this was a huge turn off and this is because i wont consider staying there again. swimming pool's dimensions are disproportional to the standards.. if u like to avail swimming pool, stay away from this hotel. Gym was not too good - less number of machines.. I stayed in Media One hotel though.. that was an awesome experience. .check that one out..

Reviews.Title: “New Year 2011”
Reviews.Author: dumbarton1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights over New Year before joining a cruise ship for a Gulf cruise. On the whole we found this to be a very enjoyable stay. Our room was fairly large and we had views over the Burj Al Arab Hotel and Ski Dubai. We had New Years dinner in Prego's italian restaurant and we agreed that it was a superb meal and was up there amongst the best that we have ever eaten, and we have eaten in some pretty good restaurants over the years. The meal was reasonably priced and was inclusive of wine party hats and crackers and the staff were extremely polite and efficient. After our meal we adjourned to the terrace where not only were we give an excellent disco by the hotel, we had views of the fireworks from the al Arab and the Al Khalifa. On a minus side though, we went into the City about 10am on the Saturday morning and when we returned about 3pm our room had not been made up. We were told the this would take about half an hour but when we retuned then we were told that it would take another half an hour. After some input from the duty manager we eventually accessed our room after about forty minutes. On the whole we enjoyed our short time at the hotel and may return there in the future if we ever go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sarroun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Dubai Film Festival and it was chosen by the company. It was an excellent hotel. The rooms are very nice, spacious, clean, and quiet. Breakfast was one of the best i have experienced in terms of variety and quality, and i have been to many hotels in different parts of the world. Service was impeccable, the health club and pool were perfect, and i enjoyed my stay thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai”
Reviews.Author: OntheroadVani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and reasonable. Spacious room, decent food and great breakfast buffet. Can see Ski Dubai from the hotel room. The Train is a 10 minute walk away and a great mode of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with good transport links”
Reviews.Author: SaqibQ
Reviews.Content: I liked 1) hotel rooms which were spacious and modern 2) the Italian restaurant on the ground floor which had brilliant food 3) the breakfast buffet which was huge, fresh and really good I didn't like i) the hotel room views are typically other tall rise buildings All in all, an excellent, smallish hotel which is next to Sheikh Zayed Road, near the Mall of the Emirates, beach and Dubai Marina. It's not expensive

Reviews.Title: “holiday oct 12 2011”
Reviews.Author: ads m
Reviews.Content: we arrived early hours of the morning however the service at reception was amazing, very polite and helpful and even upgraded our bedroom has we were on honeymoon. throughout the day the room was always cleaned, iron was provided and curtious calls were made making sure everthing is okay when service was required. good facilities and chill out areas. the concierge service were very polite and informative providing leaflets and maps. the food was great and was very clean. never had to wait for a lift as there was 4! taxis were always outside but beware of prices!! The hotel staff are very well trained and polite i was very impressed. i realised afterwards that this was a business hotel however there was couples there and young people. my only negative is while at the pool alot of people and myself were dissapointed by the pool. it was practicaly unhealthy , not clean, small, in the corners was breaking apart didnt look 5 star treatment at all. but apart from this it was a great experience and i would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near International Businesses”
Reviews.Author: MfromAms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The staff are extremely pleasant and very helpful except for a few times when trying to communicate with housekeeping and laundry services. They did not understand English very well and twice I had to hang up and start over with the front desk. We were upgraded to a suite which was lovely. It overlooked the pool and while we could hear music from the pool bar it was not enough to keep me awake at night and I am a very light sleeper. The bed was very comfortable. The toiletries were L'Occitane. The staff at Club Rotana, the business lounge were fantastic and the food was very good. It wasn't heavily used while we were there so it was a nice quiet place to have a snack and drink. The room was well cleaned but not until very late in the day. One day I finally called at 5:45 pm to ask for the room to be cleaned. After that I started asking to have the room cleaned as I was leaving the hotel in the morning. The area is not near the tourist sites. The metro is about a 10 minute walk and is cheap, clean and easy to use. Late October/early November the walk is fine, if a bit dusty, but I wouldn't want to do it in the heat of summer. It takes about 30 minutes to get into town via the metro. Taxis are easy to get and also relatively inexpensive. 38 AED from the hotel to Dubai Mall. Internet City is a very short and cheap taxi ride away. Overall, an excellent business or tourist hotel if you don't mind being a bit away from the major tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but you can do better in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: whitemountainman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but not quite up to the attention to detail you expect in a Dubai Hotel. The front desk people were courteous and professional but check in was way too slow. I asked for a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room. Since I had traveled all day and it was late, I stayed there the first night and it was quite unpleasant. I called the desk in the morning and they apologized and switched me. The new room was very good. Laundry service used twice. Very good and on time. Where the hotel falls down is the restaurants. Breakfast buffet was really a pain in the neck. We had to chase down staff for utensils and coffee. They seemed unable to grasp the concept when two of us arrived and asked for a table for four and explained that our other two were doing some quick business at the front desk. We had to chase down staff for utensils and coffee. Even though we asked several times, our second two people waited and waited for place settings. The buffet was not crowded at that time. It's things like this that irritate people in the mornings. The food was actually really good. We had to catch a midnight flight on the night that we were leaving and decided to get some food on the terrace. We gave ourselves plenty of time but the service was so slow and the servers so detached that we had to wolf our food and run to make it to the airport. It shouldn't take the better part of an hour to serve a club sandwich. The hotel is on the edge of town. Not near anything of interest and nothing is walkable. Taxis are cheap in Dubai so you can get where you need to be without much trouble. I suggest staying near Dubai Creek or on Jumeireh Beach where you'll pay around the same money and be nearer to points of interest. The Sofitel is my point of reference and they beat this hotel as I said in attention to detail. You'll have a decent stay here, but this is Dubai. The hotel needs to step up its game.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & excellent value”
Reviews.Author: annmarie45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 night stopover last weekend on way back from Mauritius. Thank you so much for the fabulous upgrade to a suite, it was marvellous, so much space, light and airy. Have visited Dubai on 4 previous occasions but 1st time to stay here as it was offered by our tour company at a very reasonable rate. Lovely hotel, fantastic service from all staff, doormen, reception, Channels breakfast staff, room service. Thank you for our packed breakfast on our very early departure, it was greatly appreciated. the attention to detail and response from staff was extremely positive/welcoming and nothing appeared too much trouble. Lovely terrace bar beside the pool to sit out in the evening. Hotel is not in the main tourist areas and nothing in the vicinity for tourists, however, plenty of taxis available and very cheap. All the taxi drivers we had, were polite, courteous and had no trouble taking us directly to our chosen destinations. one even asked our permission to take a detour as a road was blocked due to an accident and an anticipated wait of 30-40mins for it to clear. He even turned off the meter!!!! I would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again, especially if their rates remain as reasonable. (well worth the costs of taxis). It was only approx £3 to Mall of Emirates, £4 to Jumeriah Madinat, £4 to Jumeriah Beach Resort & £15 to airport, well worth it. Thank you again for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aj778899
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, okay location, right in the heart of media city. Gym is good. Pool is nice. Only negative is that food and drink in hotel is expensive But great hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geofflondon
Reviews.Content: This was fine but we were only there for 2 night on the way to Mauritius. The big issue here is that is out of town. Not that far from the Emerates mall but far enough. It takes about 45 mins to drive to the airport. We were in Dubai in Ramadan and for us that was an issue although you can consume alcohol on hotel premises. It was possible to find somewhere to eat at lunch but you had to look and food was expensive in those places that were open. The hotel has good quality rooms, the air con works well and it was not noisy. We had expected some since it is in an area being developed. The staff were very good and helpful. If you take a cab the hoel has them lined up by the exit but these are at a premium price. The standard cabs, which abound, are much cheaper and can be found a few yards away. Beware, though, of walking about; it is incredibly hot and you are advised to go from one air conditioned environment to another. The fountain with music is super and well worth a cab there and back. Take a drink at Carluccio's and watch it in comfort. The shopping, perportedly cheap, is not i.e. in the malls. We shopped in the souk, full of indian and Iranian small shops. Loads of fake goods some of which are good. It is worth seeking out a shop selling perfume both mens and womens. These are the same fragrances that you are familiar with and made in the same factory in Switzerland, the difference being that these are stroinger and oil based. The fragrances last a very long time so you use less. The price is very reasonable. The gold souk and spice souk are interesting. The museum is okay and a trip over the creek on a boat is worthwhile. My advice is to bargain and bargain hard but not in the malls where you are required to pay what is shown. In Debenhams my wife assures me cosmetics were considerably more expensive than they are in my local branch. Food in our hotel was of reasonable quality (Italian|) but portions are not large and it took a while to be served. If you ask the cabbies or the vendors in the souk they will advise you where to eat. We went to a Persian restaurant, very basic but the food was superb, very good value and the atmosphere was very interesting. Breakfast in the hotel was very good, that is if you don't mind turkey bacon. Is that an oxymoron? It was buffet style with freshly made for you omlette or fried eggs. Great variety of fruit. Waiter service to be seated and to serve drinks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ChesterPinkpanther
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stop over in Dubai which turned into the best part of three due to the hotel kindly letting us check into our room at 530am. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and they even gave us some special desserts as we were on honeymoon. The terrace was really relaxed and complete with pool and bar was very welcome! The hotel is a little bit out of the main city but easy to reach by taxi or metro. Amazing choice at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: manjitp
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we noticed the hotel was in an area that was still being developed however that can be said for most of Dubai. No queues at check in however at 11pm we did expect our room to be ready. However as Sajaad on reception explained the hotel was extremely busy and our room would not be ready for another hour. A little fustrated after a long flight however we killed time by taking a look around the hotel. (However we were upgraded to a suite which made up for this inconveinence) The swimming pool area was excellant, clean and never busy. However due to the building orientation the swimming pool only ever got direct sunlight for a few hours of the day. Gym was well equipped and like the pool area never really seemed busy. The suite we were given was big which when travelling with family is a godsend. All in all the hotel was very good. Now a special note about the service. All staff were extremely firendly and helpful, nothing seemed too much trouble. The staff at Channels coffee bar provided us with warm millk for my young son everyday with a smile and nothing was too much touble for them. chef Philip and his staff did an excellant job with the food and again nothing seemed like too much trouble for them. Being picky the only one thing i would welcome as an improvement would be free wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if on business or otherwise”
Reviews.Author: BatoolBahroz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were looking for our apartment to move in, in Dubai, We stayed for a week and we were both totally satisfied with the service even though the hotel was on full occupancy due to the festival of Eid. They have an Italian restaurant which is great with a perfect cuisine and ambiance. they also have an oriental restaurant which serves good food. Breakfast buffet has variety and is really good. Rooms are a little dark in terms of lighting but they are spacious and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was nice and clean. Overall a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent bars and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sleepy23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we had an unexpected powercut recently. Called up and said I needed a room for family. Everything was taken care of from the minute we arrived. Had a well deserved drink in the bar and a late dinner in the itanian restaurant in the lobby. The hotel is perfect 4 star with OK sized rooms, clean, modern with plenty of towels and decent TV. The downside is the area where the hotel is built called Tecom. Dubai municpality seems to have halted development of all the infrastucture in this area, so the streets and pavements are not complete. Still this hotel is very popular with expats living nearby for a drink in the Nelson pub or to eat in the restaurant, which is always packed at the weekend. There is also a play area for kids in the lobby which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel.. very okay..wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Karam s
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights through reviews.. but I was not at all impressed with this hotel. Rooms are not really comfortable and have basic enmities. Bathroom was very okay not super great.. really old look. I booked a premium room though. The sofa was so uncomfortable to sit On and had to resort to the bed.. The lobby is lively and so is the coffee shop. Location wise this place is 15 mins drive to emirates mall. Also there is not much around this hotel and you have to take a taxi by all means. The only good part is a very friendly staff and a clean hotel. They have no affiliation with any airline for points as well..so you are empty handed with no rewards! Overall a very okay hotel nothing great.. just a sleep over hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, 5-star Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvaler_66_2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, excellent attention to detail. Central location to Palm Jumairah, JBR, Mall of the Emirates. Great access to highway (depends on Dubai Transport Authority though as construction is endless). The restaurants are very good, the hotel bar is adequate - though for serious pub goers, not my first choice - pool is excellent, and gym facilities are top notch. The spa is use only if needed; I woudl otherwise recommend Sensasia at the EMirates Gold Club close by. You will not be disappointed if you are traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: duckymarsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Ramadan last week. Great size rooms that were very clean. Pregos (italian restaurant) has great food. Nice and cheep room. Close to Dubai Marina dn the Mall of the Emirates

Reviews.Title: “the usual gorgeous Rotana rooms”
Reviews.Author: kcindxb
Reviews.Content: Rotana is our favorite chain in the UAE. They get the rooms right in all the brands, and usually the service and F+B. Sorry but this is the exception. While we had some great food, the service is Dubai-style- inattentative, uncaring and not well trained. Its too bad- Barsha has a ton of hotels, and in Dubai for locals we go for F+B (mostly B!) and this spot is not a pleasure. Insh'allah they will get there act together!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: vale_s81
Reviews.Content: That was my second stay, and I really enjoyed it. Bedrooms are so clean and big and so comfortable. So nice the gift of the orchids left on the pillows. Sometimes this small things makes the difference. The service is excellent. The swimming pool is so big. Enjoyed also the pool bar and the restaurant. Very good cuisine. Very good breakfast so many different things from fresh fruits to cakes to eggs and bacon. I surely came back.

Reviews.Title: “v good hotel if i have to stay in the area then it will be on my list”
Reviews.Author: icelolly25
Reviews.Content: very clean hotel but staff were not so great at the check out and made me wait ages before I could check in. Its very modern, clean but not many shops etc in the foyer and the restaurants are good but expensive. It has lots of taxis so getting around is not to bad. Had a lovely room with a big glass window way up in the tower. Very clean and a huge bathroom. Overall very high class and nice ..I woould not recommend it for a family but for a couple or for business it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, and an upgrade too!”
Reviews.Author: cumbrianmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Media Rotana in April for two nights en route to Australia. Arrived very late at night (or very early in the morning) and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. Even upgraded us which is always appreciated! Hotel was spotless and the staff were excellent. A little distance away from main attractions but taxi's were always available (and not very expensive). Only had room service but it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not awsome”
Reviews.Author: iQatar
Reviews.Content: When i checked in they gave a different room than the one i reserved for which was disappointment for me. I talked to them but no solutions were given.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back for sure !”
Reviews.Author: RoadORotten
Reviews.Content: I Just liked it soooo much! Room and Bathroom vere shining clean...The Towels were all new and clean, Thank you all at Rotana Media ...I really enjoyed stsying there. like always can not comment on the facilities cause it was a business trip and I had to be outside of the hotel most of the time, but I am sure I MISSED SOMETHING ! Thank you again , If I be bac I ll be there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: davenkim
Reviews.Content: I checked into this place after having ended up in a mediocre hotel. This place certainly lifted my spirits. The facilities are top notch, breakfast was excellent as was the evening buffets. The Nelsons bar can get a little smokey. The pool was of a nice size and well served by a bar. Will use this hotel next time I 'm in town

Reviews.Title: “Good value deal”
Reviews.Author: ExpatscotAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Shopped around and got a deal which was around AED350 for this hotel. Spacious rooms and bathroom. Great shower. Location not glamourous but safe and easy to get taxis. NOt an area which looks very nice to walk around as it is still being developed. Close to a few other hotels with bars, restaurants and nightlife About 10 mins in a taxi from the Marina and 5 to Mall of the Emirates. Good breakfast and reasonably priced. Gym is well equipped. Pool disappointing as it seemed to be in the shade but a nice patio area where you could sit in the sunshine. Also had yoga classes available at extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty package”
Reviews.Author: muscledtraveller
Reviews.Content: When I first turned the corner in the taxi towards the hotel I felt that this one seems to be in a very desolate area with desert sands still keeping it company. But, in the daytime could see the new Dubai skyline emerging around. Media Rotana would be a good choice for people having work in the Knowledge Village. It is a hard core business hotel and on of those Rotana hotels that is no nonsense. Just offering your practical comforts and luxury thrown in here and there. The room was cozy but very well appointed. The kind which makes you want to curl up in bed and watch tv. Probably because of its dark carpet and mild lighting. The bathroom on the other hand was spacious in comparison to the cozy room. the breakfast spread in the coffee shop is good but besides that am sure guests would like to visit other restaurants and hotels in the vicinity. Dubai Marina is not very far which of course offers a great variety of everything. A place to see and be seen. Make sure you ask for a west facing room especially in the summer months otherwise the east facing ones wont let you sleep with the stark desert sun rising early in case you happen to be one of those who sleeps with the night curtain open.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Experience”
Reviews.Author: vtransform
Reviews.Content: Peaceful hotel, not too much of buzz, relaxed away from main Dubai but close to Mall of Emirates. Not a great view from the room- Concrete buildings however if lucky than can get a glimpse of Sea shore. Good food and lovely people to assit you. Of course variety of restrautants with options for dive into pool. i also liked their conference halls well equipped and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...due to current road constructions finding the place may be tricky”
Reviews.Author: entdoctor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice one with friendly staff however the check in does take a significant waiting period . Rooms are spacious but the carpet could have been still better. Due to constructions and diversions the view is just fine.Equipped with swimming pool and gym with helpful trainers.The breakfast menu was nice for initial days but gets boring if its a long stay.Conciarge was helpful when we lost our way enroute to the hotel. Overall a nice place to stay for short breaks

Reviews.Title: “isolated location”
Reviews.Author: ぴりぃ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Dubai Internet City and Media City. It is good location for the business man . But litle bit isolated location. You have to use car or taxi to have a lunch or dinner outside hotel. The room is very clean and big.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good property, yet the rooms had peculiar smell.”
Reviews.Author: Rajesh_in
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel ,as this was booked through my office in Dubai. It is close to my office in Dubai. It is efficient hotel and staff was helpful. Though the rooms had a peculiar smell which could improve. Break fast spread was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey breakfast and a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Media Rotana. Check in painfully slow as indeed was checkout. They need to do something in that department. Otherwise room was comfortable - separate rain shower in the bathroom was nice as was the selection of TV channels. Breakfast at Dhs 99.00 was overpriced - food quality was good but not for that price.Had dinner in the Channels restaurant and it was tasty and well presented. Hotel is a bit out of the way although as has been said before taxis are plentiful but would have been nice to walk out somewhere from the hotel. My main gripe was the high cost of the internet - when will hotels learn that this revenue stream is a rip off and if the Shangri La chain can provide free internet why can't the others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas78Sweden Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room but were offered a small suite when arrival. The staff were always very helpful during our six nights stay. The location are very good if you are going to spend a lot of time on or around the Palm and Jumeirah. It is always many taxi cars outside the hotel and the staff acting very helpful and in a quick way to pick one. Nice pool area and very good arabic food on the roomservice menu.

Reviews.Title: “Descent hotel for a descent price”
Reviews.Author: frugaldiva
Reviews.Content: Media Rotana hotel is located in the Al Barasha district of Dubai, UAE. The location of the hotel would be okay if a person had their own vehicle or a rental car because it is located on the outskirts of the main attractions of Dubai. However, taxi cabs are readily available upon exiting the hotel. It is a descent hotel with a nice lobby area for guests and restaurants located inside as well. The room was nice, equipped with flat screen TV, desk area, and lounge (couch) area. The bathroom has separate bath and stand up shower. The bed, however, was not as comfortable as I expected it to be. I believe that if a pillow top mattress or some sort of mattress cushion topper was placed on the bed, it would have been more comfortable. The room service offered at the hotel had a variety of meals that would suit a person's breakfast, lunch, or dinner appetite. They were quite fast in delivery of a meal I ordered. All meal prices are written in AED (UAE) currency.

Reviews.Title: “dust bowl hotel that nickels & dimes you”
Reviews.Author: foodie_on_the_run
Reviews.Content: The trade mission I was on chose this hotel,I wouldn't have because is a budjet hotel trying to pass its self off as a 5 star. From the moment we checked in it was a hassel .The front desk wouldn't honor the rate hotel combined booked & quoted. Hit us up for an extra 100 durams a night . .It just seemed we were constantly being nickled & dimed on everything. The hotel is surounded by abanioned construction .No where to walk just an empty dust bowl. One nice point the beds are very comfortable.Still for the money there are much more interesting places to stay in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Friis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Media Rotana for 8 nights and it was one of the worst hotel experiences I ever had (and I travel a lot). The hotel itself is fine, but the service was horrible and the location leaves much to be desired. Previously arranged and written agreements were completely ignored and disregarded by the hotel. Every time I had a question or needed to make arrangements, the response from the hotel was 'We will get back to you'. However, during the 8 nights I was there, not once did they ever get back to me. Every time I asked for a taxi, I had justify why I did not want the hotel car service instead. It's fine they ask, but not accepting a no, is completely unacceptable. I could go on... for 8 days lots of things went wrong every single day. All things that on it's own could be ignored, but when it is all day, every day for 8 days, it's not OK anymore. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel in new up and coming district of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Melypoo
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days,enroute to Manchester on first A380 there.hotel reception staff polite and knowledgable,business centre casual,Nelsons british sports bar busiest in area,more atmosphere than the Grande Millenium hotel nearby.swimming pool and outside dining area.well appointed and large .coffee bar and other restaurants.taxi rank outside.10 mins walk to MTR train at Dubai Internet city station. some building work nearby but no noise in hotel. next to the main road to the airport. hotel room large with 3 piece suite,shower and bath,digital safe,bathrobe provided.,large lcd tv on wall. free daily newspaper,,tea and coffee making.. Dubai Mall and Mall of the Emirates both a short taxi drive away. Atlantis resort a 10 minute drive. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Shahror
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room. Very good restaurant near all the attraction site in new Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Pool Area, Celeb's like it too!”
Reviews.Author: GandTBahrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Jazz Festival in February - and it turns out so did James Morrisson who we were going to see - he sat at the pool bar next to us!! The hotel is really nice, clean, good staff. Pool area and bar is great although if you are a sun worshiper you have to keep moving beds as the pool is between to two towers of the hotel on a lower floor so it does get shaded. The bar in the hotel seems popular with the locals and there is a great atmosphere in there in the evening - with a DJ and dancing. The only downside was we asked for a kingbed and got a twin room. Plus you have to pay for internet access. The hotel represents good value for money compared to some other hotels in the same class.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsovina
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good service, not much around. There are 5 restaurants at the hotel. I only tried one of them and the food was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Dubai with great service”
Reviews.Author: Alistairio
Reviews.Content: This is a plush hotel (however not as plush as the Raffles in Dubai) and is very comfortable. Food was good. Bedroom great. Room service was very efficient. They also took care of my conference requirements really well. There is also a pub downstairs where you can get a refreshing pint after a hard day. Thanks Rotana - I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “You will be vaguely dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: HighExpectationsGuy
Reviews.Content: Nice bar, which is much like the long bar in towers rotana. Pool is bland, and dull. Everything else is kinda OK, but bland. There is nowhere to walk to, but taxis are convenient, and the hotel taxi will rip you off. I probably would not go back by choice, but it is ok. and come on please, your internet charges are way too high, should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: geologist74
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel for business travellers but a bit out of the way for leisure travellers. However the hotel does run (in conjunction with other nearby hotels) a free shuttle service to Mall Of The Emirates. Channels restaurant provides an excellent buffet breakfast. Nelson Bar is great for watching sports channels and offers good bar food, but it realy ought to be non smoking. Hotel is about 20 to 30 mins from airport depending on traffic. Good internet connection. Rooms are quite nice but no views as the area around the hotel is a bit of a building site - as is most of this area of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent terrace bar and pool”
Reviews.Author: WernMachine
Reviews.Content: The Media Rotana is a no nonsense 5 star hotel in a great location. It's service and standards are first class, the rooms are spotless and tastefully furnished, the b'fast is world class. Also accessible in the lobby is the Nelson's bar which is popular with ex-pats and seems to go off nearly every night of the week. We went to the mexican night buffet in the hotel which was also excellent and includes all the booze you can drink, in Dubai! The terrace bar and pool of the media Rotana are a feature, an atmospheric place with good music, great cocktails and perfect for a balmy evening of which there are many in the UAE. The gym and pool are also excellent, no one will be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamacita1001
Reviews.Content: Compared to accommodations I usually stay (on tight budget), Media Rotana is very gorgeous but this hotel is not so impressing, it is very ordinary. I have stayed similar hotel in past years. If you come to Dubai, it doesn't have to be Media Rotana, there are many other choice with same quality. The location is not good at all. Wherever you go, you have to choose taxi ( many taxis waiting for guests outside, no worries) There are 2 restaurants in this hotel, Italian and cafe (24 hours, I think). Also, there are 2 bars, Nelson(British pub) and the Terrace(roof top). Ladies, don't miss Nelson on Tuesday night (Lady's night 21-23, maybe) Nelson pub looks very popluar, especially weekend, don't miss it, but the pub is very smoky. English Newspaper delivered every morning, plenty of TV channels and amenities, customer service desk, swimming pool and gym. Everything you might need is equipped. I booked my room from hotel.com. Breakfast was not included. If you stay here, you can earn Mileage of Emirate airline. I am happy to have stayed here, nothing is bad at all, but I would rather try another hotel if I ever come back to Dubai.

HotelInfo.Name: Media Rotana, Barsha - Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: South Al Barsha off Sheikh Zayed Road | PO Box 503030, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
